title: Refugee category visas
summary: This page provides detailed information about Australia’s Refugee category visas (subclass 200, 201, 203, 204). It explains eligibility, application requirements, processing times, obligations, and what visa holders can do once in Australia. It also outlines family inclusion rules, travel rights, and Assisted Passage support services.

delays_caused_by: health conditions requiring testing or treatment

criteria: assessed as a refugee by UNHCR and referred to Australia
proposed by immediate family member holding a Class XB visa (subclass 200, 201, 202, 203, 204)
proposed by close family member holding a refugee category visa (subclass 200, 201, 203, 204)
members of identified minority groups (women and girls, ethnic minorities, LGBTQI+) referred by UNHCR or proposed by a family member in Australia
priority_processing.note: applications accepted only in most compelling circumstances due to limited places

what_you_can_do_with_this_visa: propose family members for permanent residence
travel to and from Australia for 5 years
become an Australian citizen if eligible
attend free English classes under the Adult Migrant English Program

health_requirements.possible_waiver: may be waived for compassionate and compelling circumstances

family_inclusion.non_dependent_children: must apply for their own visa
requirements: family members applying must meet health and character requirements
non-migrating family may also need to meet health requirements
family_inclusion.declaration_warning: undeclared family members may not be eligible for humanitarian visa proposals later

assisted_passage.program_description: supports the Offshore Humanitarian Program by providing health screening, travel and medical services
services_provided: travel arrangements to Australia after visa grant

obligations: enter Australia before the initial arrival date
comply with any signed health undertaking

travel.travel_facilitation_letter: may be issued if initial arrival date has passed
travel.travel_rights: travel to and from Australia for 5 years from visa grant
travel.after_5_years: must obtain Resident Return Visa (subclass 155 or 157)
